standard_metadata.standard_description: Apply properties of operations as strategies to add, subtract, factor, and expand linear expressions with rational coefficients.

hints.content: We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $3(-2a-4)+3a$.

Let's see if the first expression is equivalent to $3(-2a-4)+3a$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \\\\ {-6a-12+3a}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 3(-2a-4)+3a  \\\\ \\\\ {-6a-12+3a}  &\stackrel{?}{=} (3)(-2a)-(3)4+3a   \\\\ \\\\ {-6a-12+3a}   &= -6a-12+3a \\\\ \\\\  \end{align}$

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $3(-2a-4)+3a$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \\\\ {3a+12}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 3(-2a-4)+3a  \\\\ \\\\ {3a+12}  &\stackrel{?}{=} (3)(-2a)-(3)4+3a   \\\\ \\\\ {3a+12}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -6a-12+3a \\\\ \\\\ {3a+12}   &\ne -3a-12\\\\ \\\\  \end{align}$
The following expression is equivalent to $3(-2a-4)+3a$ :   -  ${-6a-12+3a} $
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $-6(b+2)+8$.

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $-6(b+2)+8$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \\\\ {-6b-4}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -6(b+2)+8  \\\\ \\\\ {-6b-4}  &\stackrel{?}{=} (-6)b+(-6)2+8   \\\\ \\\\ {-6b-4}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -6b-12+8 \\\\ \\\\ {-6b-4}   &= -6b-4\\\\ \\\\  \end{align}$
The following expression is equivalent to $-6(b+2)+8$ :   -  ${-6b-4} $
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $2(-6c+3)+4c$.

Let's see if the first expression is equivalent to $2(-6c+3)+4c$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \\\\ {-8c+6}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 2(-6c+3)+4c  \\\\ \\\\ {-8c+6}  &\stackrel{?}{=} (2)(-6c)+(2)3+4c   \\\\ \\\\ {-8c+6}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -12c+6+4c   \\\\ \\\\ {-8c+6}   &= -8c+6 \\\\ \\\\  \end{align}$
The following expressions are equivalent to $2(-6c+3)+4c$ :   -  ${-8c+6} $  -  ${3(-4c+2)+4c} $
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $-4(3d-2)-7$.

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $-4(3d-2)-7$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \\\\ {12d-15}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -4(3d-2)-7  \\\\ \\\\ {12d-15}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  (-4)3d-(-4)2-7  \\\\ \\\\ {12d-15}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -12d-(-8)-7 \\\\ \\\\ {12d-15}   &\ne -12d+1\\\\ \\\\  \end{align}$
"None of the above" is the correct answer.
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $-7+3(-4e-3)$.

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $-7+3(-4e-3)$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \\\\ {12e}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -7+3(-4e-3)  \\\\ \\\\ {12e}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  -7+(3)(-4e)-(3)3    \\\\ \\\\ {12e}  &\stackrel{?}{=}-7+(-12e)-9\\\\ \\\\ {12e}   &\ne -12e-16\\\\ \\\\  \end{align}$
The following expression is equivalent to $-7+3(-4e-3)$ :   -  ${-4(3e+4)} $
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $-f-5(2f-3)$.

Let's see if the first expression is equivalent to $-f-5(2f-3)$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \\\\ {-11f-3}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -f-5(2f-3)  \\\\ \\\\ {-11f-3}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -f-(5)2f+(5)3   \\\\ \\\\ {-11f-3}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -f-10f+15   \\\\ \\\\ {-11f-3}   &\ne -11f+15 \\\\ \\\\  \end{align}$

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $-f-5(2f-3)$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \\\\ {-11f+15}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -f-5(2f-3)  \\\\ \\\\ {-11f+15}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  -f-(5)2f+(5)3      \\\\ \\\\ {-11f+15}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -f-10f+15\\\\ \\\\ {-11f+15}   &= -11f+15 \\\\ \\\\  \end{align}$
The following expression is equivalent to $-f-5(2f-3)$ :   -  ${-11f+15} $
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $3g+6(-g+(-5))$.

Let's see if the first expression is equivalent to $3g+6(-g+(-5))$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \\\\ {9g+30}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 3g+6(-g+(-5))  \\\\ \\\\ {9g+30}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 3g+(6)(-g)+(6)(-5)   \\\\ \\\\ {9g+30}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 3g+(-6g)+(-30)   \\\\ \\\\ {9g+30}   &\ne -3g-30 \\\\ \\\\  \end{align}$

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $3g+6(-g+(-5))$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \\\\ {-3g-5}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 3g+6(-g+(-5))  \\\\ \\\\ {-3g-5}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 3g+(6)(-g)+(6)(-5) \\\\ \\\\ {-3g-5}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 3g+(-6g)+(-30)  \\\\ \\\\ {-3g-5}   &\ne -3g-30\\\\ \\\\  \end{align}$
"None of the above" is the correct answer.
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $-2(2h+10)+4h$.

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $-2(2h+10)+4h$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \\\\ {-20}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -2(2h+10)+4h  \\\\ \\\\ {-20}  &\stackrel{?}{=} (-2)2h+(-2)10+4h   \\\\ \\\\ {-20}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  -4h+(-20)+4h\\\\ \\\\ {-20}   &= -20\\\\ \\\\  \end{align}$
The following expressions are equivalent to $-2(2h+10)+4h$ :   -  ${-20-4h+4h} $  -  ${-20} $
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $4(3j+(-4))-9$.
The following expression is equivalent to $4(3j+(-4))-9$ :   -  ${-4(-3j+4)-9} $
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $5(-2k-3)+2k$.

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $5(-2k-3)+2k$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \\\\ {-15}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 5(-2k-3)+2k \\\\ \\\\ {-15}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  (5)(-2k)-(5)3+2k   \\\\ \\\\ {-15}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -10k-15+2k   \\\\ \\\\ {-15}   &\ne  -8k-15\\\\ \\\\  \end{align}$
The following expression is equivalent to $5(-2k-3)+2k$ :   -  ${(-5\cdot3)-8k} $
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $4m-2+(-8m)$.

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $4m-2+(-8m)$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \\\\ {2(2m-1)-8m}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 4m-2+(-8m)  \\\\ \\\\ {2(2m-1)-8m}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  -4m-2    \\\\ \\\\ {(2)2m-(2)1-8m}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  -4m-2  \\\\ \\\\ {4m-2-8m}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  -4m-2  \\\\ \\\\ {-4m-2}   &= -4m-2  \\\\ \\\\  \end{align}$
The following expressions are equivalent to $4m-2+(-8m)$ :   -  ${-2(4m+1) +4m} $  -  ${2(2m-1)-8m} $
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $-6n+(-12)+4n$.
The following expression is equivalent to $-6n+(-12)+4n$ :   -  ${4(n-3) -6n} $
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $5p+3p+(-9)$.

Let's see if the first expression is equivalent to $5p+3p+(-9)$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \\\\ {8p+9}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 5p+3p+(-9)  \\\\ \\\\ {8p+9}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 8p+(-9)   \\\\ \\\\ {8p+9}   &\ne 8p-9 \\\\ \\\\  \end{align}$
The following expression is equivalent to $5p+3p+(-9)$ :   -  ${3(p+(-3))+5p} $
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $-6+4q+(-6q)$.

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $-6+4q+(-6q)$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \\\\ {2(q-3)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -6+4q+(-6q)  \\\\ \\\\ {2(q-3)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -2q-6  \\\\ \\\\ {(2)q-(2)3}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  -2q-6 \\\\ \\\\ {2q-6}   &\ne  -2q-6\\\\ \\\\  \end{align}$
"None of the above" is the correct answer.
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $12r-5$.
The following expressions are equivalent to $12r-5$ :   -  ${6(2r+(-1))+1} $  - ${-4(2+(-3r))+3}$
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $-3(2w+6)-4$.
The following expression is equivalent to $-3(2w+6)-4$ :   -  ${2(-3w+(-11))} $
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $-6+3(2+(-4t))$.
The following expression is equivalent to $-6+3(2+(-4t))$ :   -  ${-12t} $
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $5+(-3)(6x-5)$.
"None of the above" is the correct answer.
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $-2y-8+4y$.

Let's see if the first expression is equivalent to $-2y-8+4y$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \\\\ {-2(y+4)+4y}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -2y-8+4y  \\\\ \\\\ {(-2)y+(-2)4+4y}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -2y-8+4y   \\\\ \\\\ {-2y+(-8)+4y}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -2y-8+4y   \\\\ \\\\ {-2y-8+4y  }   &=-2y-8+4y  \\\\ \\\\  \end{align}$

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $-2y-8+4y$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \\\\ {4(-2+y)-2y}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -2y-8+4y  \\\\ \\\\ {(4)(-2)+(4)y-2y}  &\stackrel{?}{=} -2y-8+4y  \\\\ \\\\ {-8+4y-2y}  &\stackrel{?}{=}-2y-8+4y  \\\\ \\\\ {-2y-8+4y}   &=-2y-8+4y \\\\ \\\\  \end{align}$
The following expressions are equivalent to $-2y-8+4y$ :  -  ${-2(y+4)+4y} $  -  ${4(-2+y)-2y} $
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $4(-5z+2)+(-6)$.
The following expression is equivalent to $4(-5z+2)+(-6)$ :   -  ${2(-10z+1)} $
